abstract: While other executives received most or all of their targeted bonus amounts for 2006, James R. Tobin was awarded only 35 percent of his after a year of troubles at the maker of medical devices.
snippet: While other executives received most or all of their targeted bonus amounts for 2006, James R. Tobin was awarded only 35 percent of his after a year of troubles at the maker of medical devices.
lead_paragraph: According to federal regulators who slapped Boston Scientific with a rare company-wide warning letter early last year, quality problems with its medical devices were wide-ranging and persistent. The company’s audacious $27 billion acquisition of Guidant in a bidding war with Johnson & Johnson was viewed on Wall Street as too expensive at best. And sales of its biggest product, the Taxus drug-coated stent, sagged on safety fears and concerns among doctors such stents are being used too aggressively.

headline.main: C.E.O. Sees His Bonus Cut at Boston Scientific
